result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew D Hanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation/extended supervision now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Seek and maintain employment, commensurate with his treatment needs.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with Karyn Youngthunder, or any known illegal drug users or dealers.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Amended 8/2/18.  Credit for 331 days.  Figured as follows:  arrested on 8/20/15 and remained in custody until 5/31/16.  Served another sentence from 5/31/16 to 9/20/16.  Then resumed in custody on this case from 9/20/16 through 11/3/16.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any sentence now serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: same as prison sentence.

records.addlTxt: This is ADA Hynek's reponse regarding the amended verification of time served filed by the DOC. So assuming the judge's other reason for denying is no longer applicable, I guess I don't object."  I forwarded the response from ADA Hynek by email to Judge Becker.

Transcript of sentencing after revocation hearing held on 8/2/2018

Assistant District Attorney, Emily Hynek appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Sebion.  Parties have the revocation packet.  Parties have concerns regarding the amount of credit.  Amend original JOC to correct days of credit originally granted.  State recommended:   3 years total, bifurcated as 1 year initial confinement and  2 years extended supervision.   Defense says this is a joint recommendation. 

Credit:   presentence.  434 days.  Post conviction. 166 days.  

Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution.  

Court ordered:   3 -1/2 years total, bifurcated as 1- 1/2 years initial confinement and  2 years extended supervision. Consecutive to any sentence he is now serving.  CC.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with es conditions.  AODA and recomended treatment.  Subject to random testing by his agent.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Eligible for CIP and SAP.  

Credit:   Original credit ordered from August 20 - May 31, 2016.  Sept 20, 2016 - Nov 3 2016,  on original JOC.  331 days.  Was serving a sentence from  5/31/16 to 9/ 20/16 and there were no other holds.
of 6/28/18 SEHR notice.  No longer in custody at the La Crosse County Jail.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Gardner.  Amended information filed with the court.  Count 1 amended to <= 3 grams as a repeater.  Class F Felony.  Amendment approved by the court.  Reading of the amended information waived.  Defendant plead no contest to the amended count 1.  Remaining counts dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.   Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Repeater allegation confirmed by the court.  Felony warnings given to the defendant by the court.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g), contrary to 961.41(1m)(d)1., as a repeater.  Joint recommendation for:  probation.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  No contact with known dealer or users.  s/m employment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  No contact with Karyn Youngthunder.  

Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 4 years probation.  Concurrent with any probation/extended supervision now serving.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.     Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located. AODA and recommended treatment.   No contact with any known illegal drug dealers or users.  No contact with Karyn Youngthunder.  Seek and maintain employment, commensurate with his treatment needs.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Subject to random alcohol and drug testing by his agent.  CC.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.  Call probation on 2/23 in BRF and check in with his agent in La Crosse to make arrangments to sign up for probation.  Credit to be determined.

1 - Confidential Report of Laboratory Findings

Defendant Andrew D Hanson in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner.  Defendant Andrew D Hanson in custody.  Melissa S. Inlow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Witness EM sworn and testified. Exh 1 - Laboratory findings. Record reflects identification of defendant. Cross examination by defense. Redirect by prosecution. Prosecution moves Exhibit 1. Exhibit 1 admitted and received. Court found probable cause and bound over for trial. Information filed and 2 copies provided to Atty Gardner. Defense waived reading of Information. Court advised charge and potential penalties. Defense stood mute on all counts. Court entered not guilty pleas. Bond will continue.

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.   Defendant appeared in by video from the jail.  Attorney Poss appeared in court. Court confirmed that the defendant understood the charges.   Reading of complaint waived.
Adjourned initial appearance at 08-31-2015 09:30 am
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Defendant contacted SPD.  Waiting for paperwork.  Adjourned day to day.  Bond continued.

Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail with no attorney present.  DA Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant admits to receipt of complaint.  Court reviews charges and potential penalties.  He understands.  He has not spoken to attorney yet.  Court directs him to contact the public defender's office and if he does not qualify he may petition.  DA requests a $1000 cash bond with the following conditions:  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to be present where controlled substances are used or sold.  Must comply with all bond conditions in La Crosse County case 15CT149 or any other pending cases.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses:  K. Y.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Not to leave La Crosse County for any reason unless it's to appear in court in Jackson County or meet with your attorney.  Court so orders bond as requested; sets an adjourned initial appearance for 8-24-15 at 9:30.
Adjourned initial appearance at 08-24-2015 09:30 am
